line_1: Well pleas'd he wanders o'er the fallow lea,
line_2: Ne'er be my lot the brawling courts to see;

line_1: Well pleas'd he wanders o'er the fallow lea,
line_2: Who trusts to lawyer's tongue doth much misween, perdy.

line_1: The lowing herd wind slowly o'er the lea,
line_2: And leaves the world to darkness and to me.

line_1: Bounding in gamesome measure o'er the lea,
line_2: And shadowing fragrance drops from every tree.

line_1: Great in their bloody arms, march'd o'er the lea,
line_2: Now lost to them! and, ah how chang'd to me!

line_1: The lowing herd wind slowly o'er the lea,
line_2: And leaves the world to darkness and to me.

line_1: Or where old Cam soft-paces o'er the Lea,
line_2: From the fam'd City by Propontis Sea,

line_1: Or where old Cam soft-paces o'er the Lea,
line_2: Thence from their cloister'd Walks he set them free,

line_1: Or where old Cam soft-paces o'er the Lea,
line_2: And brought them to another Castalie:

line_1: And winter whistl'd o'er the lea,
line_2: WHEN the last leaf forsook the tree,

line_1: River, and glen, and mountain, wood and lea,
line_2: Where every thing around, tower, turret, tree,

line_1: River, and glen, and mountain, wood and lea,
line_2: Thy once beloved Melrose, — all speak of thee,

line_1: And dancing hand in hand rejoice the lea.
line_2: The happy gardens of Adonis lay:

line_1: And dancing hand in hand rejoice the lea.
line_2: Ne yet his wings were fledg'd, ne locks were grey;

line_1: And dancing hand in hand rejoice the lea.
line_2: Round him in sweet accord the Seasons play
